title: HTML5
content: HyperText Markup Language (version 5.)

title: CSS3
content: Cascading StyleSheets (version 3.)

title: Bootstrap
content: Bootstrap is a CSS framework, offering you a cornucopia of pre-set classes and styles out-of-the-box.

title: Foundation
content: Foundation is a CSS framework, offering you a cornucopia of pre-set classes and styles out-of-the-box.

title: Bulma
content: Bulma is a CSS framework, offering you a cornucopia of pre-set classes and styles out-of-the-box.

title: Semantic UI
content: Foundation is a CSS framework, offering you a cornucopia of pre-set classes and styles out-of-the-box.

title: JavaScript
content: Used for functionality, and handling of interactivity, in the front-end of websites.

title: ECMAScript 6
content: A specific version of JavaScript that introduces new features like "class" arrow-style function.

title: jQuery
content: A library intended to assist with backwards compatability, ease of JavaScript plugin creation, and simplification of code.

title: Slick
content: A JavaScript library for easy sliders.

title: ChartJS
content: A JavaScript library for easy charts.

title: Axios
content: A JavaScript library for easy AJAX requests.

title: TypeScript
content: A superset of JavaScript with enhanced types.

title: React
content: A JavaScript library for managing the interactive "view" layer of a website application.

title: Redux
content: When "local" state isn't enough, Redux provides a more "global" solution.

title: PHP
content: PHP Hypertext Preprocessor language is used as a general-purpose and website application (server-side) solution.

title: WordPress
content: The leading blogging platform on the web, powering more than 30% of websites; built in PHP.

title: Databases
content: Used as a persistant storage solution, typically for web or software solutions.

title: MySQL
content: A database management system utilizing an "Structured Query Language" for request formatting.

title: C#
content: A programming language typically utilized for native desktop software or website applications.

title: .NET CORE
content: A C# framework developed by Microsoft for accelerated web and desktop application development.
